Posts.Content: Babysister: yes, I did have to go in for a biopsy and in my case I was in the 20%, it was cancer. I had more than just the calcifications, I also had a mass that showed up on the ultrasound.
Posts.Title: microcalcifications

Posts.Content: When I posted that I had been called back for further mammograms I was told that it is pretty common. If they do find something, 80% of the time it is benign. It's easy to say "don't worry" (I know, I've been there) but a lot harder not to actually worry. All I can say to you is that worrying won't do anything to help you at all so try to put it out of your mind. I just kept telling myself that 80% of the time it's nothing. That helped.
Posts.Title: microcalcifications

Posts.Content: Ok, I can help you a little. Ten o"clock is just where it would be on a clock if you were directly looking at it. On the left breast it is on the inner/upper side. Nine o'clock is in line with the nipple, ten o'clock is a little above. I had a cyst removed from my left breast 28 years ago, it was benign.
Posts.Title: ???? about my mammogram report

Posts.Content: I had the Mammosite 2x a day for 5 days internal radiation. I assume that is what your MIL is having. I had a "balloon" inserted into my breast to hold the radiation. They ran an MRI every time before to make sure that the balloon was in the exact right spot and that it hadn't burst. This was in August of this year.
